intro: Sabazia liebmannii var. ovatifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sabazia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. This species is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
